message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR, cs.CL

The paper deals with the problem of zero-shot learning in the domain of 3D point cloud classification, which is a subfield of computer vision (CV). Therefore, cs.CV is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes a novel triplet loss for transductive zero-shot learning, which involves machine learning (ML) techniques such as deep learning and neural networks. Hence, cs.LG (machine learning) and cs.AI (artificial intelligence) are also likely sub-categories. The paper also deals with the challenges of 3D point cloud classification, which involves geometry and topology, making cs.GR (graphics) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper also discusses the applicability of the proposed approach to 2D image classification, which involves natural language processing (NLP) techniques for semantic embeddings, making cs.CL (computation and language) a possible sub-category.
